explanations.c: Torsion is defined as the twisting of a specimen caused by a certain amount of torque. Compressive forces are forces that are applied to an object that results in the specimen getting compacted.

questions.question: Which of the following cannot be determined using a torsion test?

explanations.d: Modulus of elasticity in shear, torsion yield strength and modulus of rupture can all be determined by performing torsion test on material.

questions.question: ________ is a measure of the strength of shaft in rotation.

explanations.c: The polar modulus is a measure of the strength of shaft in rotation. As the value of Polar modulus increases torsional strength increases.

What are the units of torsional rigidity?

explanations.a: The product of modulus of rigidity (C) and polar moment of inertia (J) is called torsional rigidity. Torsional rigidity is a torque that produces a twist of one radian in a shaft of unit length.
